Jamia Millia Islamia admissions 2025 are open to various courses. A few more updates are as follows:

  • MBA/BEd (ODL) mode, and BA/BCom/BBA/MCom/MA/UG Diploma/PG Diploma (OL) mode applications are closed. Further, the entrance test for MBA/BEd (ODL) is to be held on Mar 1, 2025.

  • The CUET PG 2025 exam dates have been revised for admission to PG courses. As per the notification, the exam is scheduled to be held between Mar 13, 2025, and Apr 1, 2025.

Jamia Millia Islamia Highlights 2025

Jamia Millia Islamia (also known as JMI) is a central university located in Delhi. It was established in 1920 by an Act of the Parliament of India and is recognised by the UGC. Some of the courses offered by Jamia Millia are approved by AICTE and NCTE and accredited by the NBA. Jamia Millia Islamia University is accredited with an A ++ Grade by NAAC.

Jamia Millia Islamia is ranked 3rd by NIRF 2024 under the Universities category. QS World University Rankings 2025 has also placed it in the band of 851-900. Jamia Millia Islamia, through various departments and centres, offers UG, PG, PhD, distance learning, and various other courses to students across Chemistry, Computer Science, and various other streams. Jamia is famous for its flagship BSc, MSc, and PhD courses. Some of the important highlights regarding Jamia Millia Islamia University are mentioned below:

Jamia Millia Islamia History

Some of the historical facts of Jamia Millia Islamia University are listed below:

  • JMI University was established in Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh on October 29, 1920.
  • The university was established after the demands from the Aligarh Muslim University's students to have a new National Muslim University, free from the influence of the British Government.
  • Many eminent Indian personalities such as Zakir Hussain (Former President of India) and Mahatma Gandhi (Father of the Nation), also supported the establishment of JMI University.
  • Mahatma Gandhi also sent his youngest son, Devdas Gandhi to teach Hindi at the university.
  • Jamia Millia Islamia moved from Aligarh to Karol Bagh, New Delhi, in 1925.
  • In 1936, all the institutions of the university, except a few moved to the new campus of the university, in Jamia Nagar, Delhi.
  • The UGC recognised it as a deemed university in 1962.
  • Jamia Millia Islamia finally received the status of a 'Central University' by an act of the Parliament in 1988.
  • King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia visited the university in 2006 and donated USD 30 million for the construction of a library and a research centre.

Commonly asked questions
On Highlights

Q:   How can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia?

A: 

Aspiring students are required to register on the official website of CUET fill the application form online. In the form, fill all the details asked, upload the required documents and pay the application fee. Starting 2022, for BA, BSc and BVoc, JMI started accepting the scores of CUET UG. For the same, students need to register for the exam, appear for it and qualify it. Qualified students of CUET UG are required to register for JMI counselling after which merit lists will be released with the name of the shortlisted students. For the remaining courses, however, the university is still accepting national and university-level entrance exam for final selection. 

Upvote

Q:   How can I take admission to JMI for MBA?

A: 

Candidates seeking admission to Jamia Millia Islamia for MBA can apply online on the official website. Admission to this course is offered based on the entrance exam conducted by the university, i.e. JMI Entrance Eest. Interested candidates must have a relevant bachelor’s degree with at least 50% aggregate in the subject concerned. Followed by application filling and before application submission, candidates are also required to pay the application fee which ranges from INR 550 to INR 700. A step-by-step process of application is mentioned below:

  1. Visit the official website and scroll down.
  2. On the Admission section in the left corner of the page, there are multiple links for course-wise application forms.
  3. Click on the desired courses' application link, fill out the application form and pay the application fee.
Upvote

Q:   Which is better JMI or AMU for BTech?

A: 

Both Aligarh Muslim University and Jamia Millia Islamia offers BTech course for a duration of four years. AMU BTech will range between INR 15,690 and INR 10.78 lakh, whereas JMI BTech fee is comparatively less i.e. INR 64,600. Talking about the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2023 rankings, AMU was ranked 32 in the Engineering category, whereas, JMI ranked 26th spot in the list. Apart from the ranking and fees, JMI BTech placements are also good when compared to AMU. During, AMU BTech placements 2022, the highest package offered was INR 21 LPA. On the other hand, Jamia Millia Islamia the highest package stood at INR 25 LPA during the 2023 BTech placements drive. So, considering all the aspects mentioned here, JMI is better than AMU for BTech. 

Upvote

Q:   How can I get admission in Jamia Millia Islamia for MA?

A: 

Jamia Millia Islamia offers a two-year MA programme to the stduents across more than 30 specialisations. It is a two-year programme spread over four semesters, admission to which is based on a candidate’s performance in JMI Entrance Exam. The final merit list for admission to MA at JMI is prepared on the basis of the candidate’s performance in the entrance test, seat reservation and relaxation criteria of JMI. The application fee for MA range from INR 550 - INR 700 for different courses and interested candidates can apply online on the official website of Jamia Millia Islamia. 

Upvote

Q:   What is JMI BDS cutoff?

A: 

Jamia Milia Islamia offers admission to BDS through NEET UG scores. Candidates can refer to the table given below to check out Jamia Milia Islamia cutoff for BDS for General category students:

Jamia Millia Islamia Application Process 2025

Jamia Millia's application process for 2025 is conducted in online mode only. Candidates willing to seek admission need to visit the official website of the university to fill out the application form, attach documents and pay the application fee. While submitting the application, candidates are required to make a payment of the application fee via credit card/ debit card/ net banking. The application fee once received successfully at JMI's end is non-refundable and no correspondence on this subject is entertained.

Jamia Millia Islamia Faculty

Jamia Millia Islamia has an experienced faculty who are PhD, diploma, and degree holders. It is the only university having a full-fledged Faculty of Architecture and Ekistics. Some faculty of Architecture and Ekistics is qualified as an architect and urban and rural planner. Jamia Millia Islamia University also invites faculty for guest lectures and hence tries to offer an opportunity for students to talk with some of the best personalities and therefore learn from them.
